text: While traditional schools offer consistent peer interactions, it's important to recognize that not all students thrive in such environments. Homeschooling provides a unique opportunity for students who may struggle with social dynamics in traditional schools to develop social skills at their own pace and in a more tailored setting. By having the freedom to choose their social interactions, homeschooled students can focus on building meaningful relationships based on shared interests and values, promoting a deeper understanding of empathy and conflict resolution.
